creator: mkurtz@san.rr.com
text:
I am using Ant V1.5 compiled July 9, 2002 and have found that the class-path in 
the manifest file I give to the jar task gets wrapped at the 70th character.  I 
am using the J2SDK/JRE version 1.4.0-b92.

The added newlines cause the class-path to be invalid and my app doesn't run 
properly.  I have a sample build.xml, .class files, and manifest that  will 
display the problem.  Let me know where to send them and I will.  For your 
convenience, I have included the snippets that might be helpful to you from the 
manifest and the build.xml files:

MANIFEST:
---------
Class-Path: ./ 
Emails.jar ../XmlDtd.jar ../CnEjbClient.jar ../FTPClient.jar ../TraceMgr.jar ../
jdom.jar ../orion.jar

Note that there are no line-feeds in the above class-path line in the manifest 
file.

Build.xml
------------
<jar jarfile="${staging.dir}/Test.jar" compress="false" 
basedir="${staging.dir}" manifest="${staging.dir}\manifest.mf">
    <patternset refid="common_app.files"/>
</jar>

Thanks,
-Mike

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
sorry. not a bug. behavior needed to meet the jar spec. 

From the <jar> documentation

Manifests are processed by the Jar task according to the Jar file specification.
Note in particular that this may result in manifest lines greater than 72 bytes
being wrapped and continued on the next line. 

And, following the link:   
No line may be longer than 72 bytes (not characters), in its UTF8-encoded form.
If a value would make the initial line longer than this, it should be continued
on extra lines (each starting with a single SPACE). 

so, we think we are doing it right and all compliant manifest reading apps think
so too. If you can find an updated version of the spec that says we shouldnt be
break lines, then you can point us to it when you reopen the bug.
